template.template: Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2
template.name: Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2

item.name: Oracle: Active parallel sessions
item.description: The number of active parallel sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Active serial sessions
item.description: The number of active serial sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Average active sessions
item.description: The average active sessions at a point in time. The number of sessions that are either working or waiting.

item.name: Oracle: Archiver state
item.description: The status of automatic archiving.

item.name: Oracle: Buffer cache hit ratio
item.description: The ratio of buffer cache hits ((LogRead - PhyRead)/LogRead).

item.name: Oracle: Global cache blocks corrupted
item.description: The number of blocks that encountered corruption or checksum failure during the interconnect.

item.name: Oracle: Global cache blocks lost
item.description: The number of lost global cache blocks.

item.name: Oracle: Cursor cache hit ratio
item.description: The ratio of cursor cache hits (CursorCacheHit/SoftParse).

item.name: Oracle: Database CPU time ratio
item.description: It is calculated by dividing the total CPU (used by the database) by the Oracle time model statistic DB time.

item.name: Oracle: Database wait time ratio
item.description: Wait time - the time that the server process spends waiting for available shared resources to be released by other server processes, such as latches, locks, data buffers, etc.

item.name: Oracle: Datafiles count
item.description: The current number of datafiles.

item.name: Oracle: Datafiles limit
item.description: The maximum allowable number of datafiles.

item.name: Oracle: Disk sort per second
item.description: The number of sorts going to disk per second.

item.name: Oracle: Enqueue timeouts per second
item.description: Enqueue timeouts per second.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Number of files
item.description: The number of files in the FRA.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Number of restore points
Oracle: FRA, Space limit
item.description: The maximum amount of disk space (in bytes) that the database can use for the Fast Recovery Area (FRA).

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Space reclaimable
item.description: The total amount of disk space (in bytes) that can be created by deleting obsolete, redundant, and other low priority files from the FRA.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Used space
item.description: The amount of disk space (in bytes) used by FRA files created in the current and all the previous FRAs.

item.name: Oracle: Get FRA stats
item.description: Get FRA statistics.

item.name: Oracle: GC CR block received per second
item.description: The global cache (GC) and the consistent read (CR) block received per second.

item.name: Oracle: Instance hostname
item.description: The name of the host machine.

trigger.name: Oracle: Instance hostname has changed (new hostname received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB Instance hostname has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Oracle: Instance name
item.description: The name of an instance.

trigger.name: Oracle: Instance name has changed (new name received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB Instance name has changed. Ack to close manually.

item.name: Oracle: Instance status
item.description: The status of the instance.

item.name: Oracle: Get instance state
item.description: The item gets its state of the current instance.

item.name: Oracle: Instance role
item.description: It indicates whether the instance is an active instance or an inactive secondary instance.

item.name: Oracle: Library cache hit ratio
item.description: The ratio of library cache hits (Hits/Pins).

item.name: Oracle: Logons per second
item.description: The number of logon attempts.

item.name: Oracle: Long table scans per second
item.description: The number of long table scans per second. A table is considered 'long' if the table is not cached and if its high-water mark is greater than five blocks.

item.name: Oracle: Memory sorts ratio
item.description: The percentage of sorts (from ORDER BY clauses or index building) that are done to disk vs in-memory.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Global memory bound
item.description: The maximum size of work area executed in automatic mode.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Aggregate target parameter
item.description: The current value of the PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET initialization parameter. If this parameter is not set, then its value is 0 and automatic management of the PGA memory is disabled.

item.name: Oracle: Get PGA stats
item.description: Get PGA statistics.

item.name: Oracle: Physical reads bytes per second
item.description: Read bytes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical reads per second
item.description: Reads per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical writes bytes per second
item.description: Write bytes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical writes per second
item.description: Writes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Ping
item.description: Test the connection to Oracle Database state.

trigger.name: Oracle: Connection to database is unavailable
trigger.description: Connection to Oracle Database is currently unavailable.

item.name: Oracle: Processes limit
item.description: The maximum number of user processes.

item.name: Oracle: Redo logs available to switch
item.description: The number of inactive/unused redo logs available for log switching.

trigger.name: Oracle: Number of REDO logs available for switching is too low (less {$ORACLE.REDO.MIN.WARN} for 5 min)
trigger.description: The number of inactive/unused REDOs available for log switching is low (database down risk).

item.name: Oracle: Rows per sort
item.description: The average number of rows per sort for all types of sorts performed.

item.name: Oracle: SQL service response time
item.description: The Structured Query Language (SQL) service response time expressed in seconds.

item.name: Oracle: Active background sessions
item.description: The number of active background sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Active user sessions
item.description: The number of active user sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions concurrency
item.description: The percentage of concurrency. Concurrency is a DB behavior when different transactions request to change the same resource. In the case of modifying data transactions, it sequentially temporarily blocks the right to change the data, the rest of the transactions are waiting for the access. In the case when the access for the resource is locked for a long time, then the concurrency grows (like the transaction queue) and this often has an extremely negative impact on the performance. A high contention value does not indicate the root cause of the problem but is a signal to search for it.

trigger.name: Oracle: Too high database concurrency (over {$ORACLE.CONCURRENCY.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: The concurrency rate exceeds {$ORACLE.CONCURRENCY.MAX.WARN}%. A high contention value does not indicate the root cause of the problem, but it is a signal to search for it. In the case of high competition, the analysis of resource consumption should be carried out. Which are the most "heavy" queries made in the database? Possibly, also session tracing. All this will help to determine the root cause and possible optimization points both in the database configuration and in the logic of building queries of the application itself.

item.name: Oracle: Session count
item.description: The count of sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Inactive user sessions
item.description: The number of inactive user sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions limit
item.description: The user and system sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions lock rate
item.description: The percentage of locked sessions. Locks are mechanisms that prevent destructive interaction between transactions accessing the same resource either user objects, such as tables and rows or system objects not visible to users, such as shared data structures in memory and data dictionary rows.

trigger.name: Oracle: Too many locked sessions (over {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.LOCK.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: The number of locked sessions exceeds {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.LOCK.MAX.WARN}% of the running sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions locked over {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME}s
item.description: The count of the prolongedly locked sessions. (You can change the duration of maximum session lock in seconds for a query by {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME} macro. Default is 600 sec).

trigger.name: Oracle: Too many sessions locked over {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME}s (over {$ORACLE.SESSION.LONG.LOCK.MAX.WARN} for 5 min)
trigger.description: The number of locked sessions exceeding {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME} seconds is too high. Long-term locks can negatively affect the database performance. Therefore, if they are detected, you should first find the most difficult queries from the database point of view and then analyze possible resource leaks.

item.name: Oracle: Get sessions stats
item.description: Get sessions statistics. {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME} -- maximum seconds in the current wait condition for counting long time locked sessions. Default: 600 seconds.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, buffer cache
item.description: The size of standard block cache.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, fixed
item.description: The fixed System Global Area (SGA) is an internal housekeeping area.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, java pool
item.description: The memory is allocated from the Java pool.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, large pool
item.description: The memory is allocated from a large pool.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, log buffer
item.description: The number of bytes allocated for the redo log buffer.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, shared pool
item.description: The memory is allocated from a shared pool.

item.name: Oracle: Get SGA stats
item.description: Get SGA statistics.

item.name: Oracle: Shared pool free %
item.description: Free memory of a shared pool expressed in %.

trigger.name: Oracle: Shared pool free is too low (less {$ORACLE.SHARED.FREE.MIN.WARN}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The free memory percent of the shared pool has been less than {$ORACLE.SHARED.FREE.MIN.WARN}% for the last 5 minutes.

item.name: Oracle: Total sorts per user call
item.description: The total sorts per user call.

item.name: Oracle: Get system metrics
item.description: The item gets the values of the system metrics.

item.name: Oracle: Get system parameters
item.description: Get a set of system parameter values.

item.name: Oracle: Temp space used
item.description: Used temporary space.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total allocated
item.description: The current amount of the PGA memory allocated by the instance. The Oracle Database attempts to keep this number below the value of the PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET initialization parameter. However, it is possible for the PGA allocated to exceed that value by a small percentage and for a short period of time when the work area workload is increasing very rapidly or when PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET is set to a small value.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total freeable
item.description: The number of bytes of the PGA memory in all processes that could be freed back to the operating system.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total inuse
item.description: It indicates how much the Program Global Area (PGA) memory is currently consumed by work areas. This number can be used to determine how much memory is consumed by other consumers of the PGA memory (for example, PL/SQL or Java).

item.name: Oracle: Uptime
item.description: The Oracle instance uptime expressed in seconds.

trigger.name: Oracle: Failed to fetch info data (or no data for 30m)
trigger.description: Zabbix has not received data for items for the last 5 minutes. The database might be unavailable for connecting.

item.name: Oracle: User rollbacks per second
item.description: The number of times that users manually issue the ROLLBACK statement or an error occurred during the users' transactions.

item.name: Oracle: User's expire password
item.description: The number of days before the password of Zabbix account expires.

trigger.name: Oracle: Zabbix account will expire soon (under {$ORACLE.EXPIRE.PASSWORD.MIN.WARN} days)
trigger.description: The password for Zabbix user in the database expires soon.

item.name: Oracle: Version
item.description: The Oracle Server version.

trigger.name: Oracle: Version has changed (new version value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: The Oracle DB version has changed. Acknowledge (Ack) to close manually.

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Get archive log info
item_prototype.description: It gets the archivelog statistics.

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Error
item_prototype.description: It displays the error message.

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Last sequence
item_prototype.description: It identifies the sequence number of the last archived redo log to be archived

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Status

trigger_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Log Archive is not valid

discovery_rule.name: Database discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning databases in the database management system (DBMS).

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Get CDB and No-CDB info
item_prototype.description: It gets the information about the container database (CDB) and non-CDB database on an instance.

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Force logging
item_prototype.description: It indicates whether the database is under force logging mode 'YES' or 'NO'.

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Log mode
Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB open status has changed. Ack to close manually.

dependency.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB is in a mounted state.

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Role

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Role has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB role has changed. Ack to close manually.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.db_force_logging["{#DBNAME}"].last()} = 0 and {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.db_log_mode["{#DBNAME}"].last()} = 1
trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Force logging is deactivated for DB with active Archivelog
trigger_prototype.description: Force Logging mode - it is very important metric for Databases in 'ARCHIVELOG'. This feature allows to forcibly write all the transactions to the REDO.

item_prototype.name: ASM '{#DGNAME}': Free size
item_prototype.description: The free size of the ASM disk group.

item_prototype.name: ASM '{#DGNAME}': Total size
item_prototype.description: The total size of the ASM disk group.

item_prototype.name: ASM '{#DGNAME}': Free size
item_prototype.description: Usage of the ASM disk group expressed in %.

trigger_prototype.name: ASM '{#DGNAME}': Disk group usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The usage of the ASM disk group expressed in % exceeds {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}

trigger_prototype.name: ASM '{#DGNAME}': Disk group usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The usage of the ASM disk group expressed in % exceeds {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}

dependency.name: ASM '{#DGNAME}': Disk group usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m)

item_prototype.name: ASM '{#DGNAME}': Get ASM stats
item_prototype.description: It gets the ASM disk group statistics.

item.host: Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2
Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2

discovery_rule.name: PDB discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning a pluggable database (PDB) in DBMS.

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB open status has changed. Ack to close manually.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB is in a mounted state.

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Get PDB info
item_prototype.description: It gets the information about the PDB database on an instance.

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace allocated, bytes
item_prototype.description: Currently allocated bytes for the tablespace (sum of the current size of datafiles).

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace free, bytes
item_prototype.description: Free bytes of the allocated space.

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace MAX size, bytes
item_prototype.description: The maximum size of the tablespace.

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Open status

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace is OFFLINE
trigger_prototype.description: The tablespace is in the offline state.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle tablespace status has changed. Ack to close.

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace used, bytes
item_prototype.description: Currently used bytes for the tablespace (current size of datafiles - the free space).

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace usage, percent
item_prototype.description: Used bytes/allocated bytes*100.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).
Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}% for 5m).

dependency.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace allocated, percent
item_prototype.description: Allocated bytes/max bytes*100.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace utilization is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}% for 5m).

dependency.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace utilization is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.UTIL.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace utilization is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.UTIL.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Get tablespace stats
item_prototype.description: It gets the statistics of the tablespace.

item.host: Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2
Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2
Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2

macro.description: The maximum percentage of used Automatic Storage Management (ASM) disk group for a high trigger expression.
The maximum percentage of used ASM disk group for a warning trigger expression.
The maximum percentage of sessions concurrency usage for a trigger expression.
The maximum percentage of used database files for a trigger expression.
This macro is used in discovery of the database. It can be overridden on host level or its linked template level.
This macro is used in discovery of the database. It can be overridden on host level or its linked template level.
The number of warning days before the password expires for a trigger expression.
The Oracle user's password.
Alert threshold for the maximum percentage of the Program Global Area (PGA) usage for a trigger expression.
Alert threshold for the maximum percentage of active processes for a trigger expression
Alert threshold for the minimum number of REDO logs for a trigger expression.
Oracle Service Name.
The maximum duration of the session lock in seconds to count the session as a prolongedly locked query.
Alert threshold for the maximum number of the prolongedly locked sessions for a trigger expression.
Alert threshold for the maximum percentage of locked sessions for a trigger expression.
Alert threshold for the maximum percentage of active sessions for a trigger expression.
Alert threshold for the minimum percentage of free shared pool for a trigger expression.
This macro is used in tablespace discovery. It can be overridden on host level or its linked template level.
This macro is used in tablespace discovery. It can be overridden on host level or its linked template level.
High severity alert threshold for the maximum percentage of tablespace usage (used bytes/allocated bytes) for a trigger expression.
Warning severity alert threshold for the maximum percentage of tablespace usage (used bytes/allocated bytes) for a trigger expression.
High severity alert threshold for the maximum percentage of tablespace utilization (allocated bytes/max bytes) for a trigger expression.
Warning severity alert threshold for the maximum percentage of tablespace utilization (allocated bytes/max bytes) for a trigger expression.
Oracle username.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.proc.stats["{$ORACLE.CONNSTRING}","{$ORACLE.USER}","{$ORACLE.PASSWORD}","{$ORACLE.SERVICE}"].min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.processes_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many active processes (over {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Active processes are using more than {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}% of the available number of processes.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.session_count.min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.session_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many active sessions (over {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Active sessions are using more than {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}% of the available sessions.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.datafiles.stats["{$ORACLE.CONNSTRING}","{$ORACLE.USER}","{$ORACLE.PASSWORD}","{$ORACLE.SERVICE}"].min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.db_files_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many database files (over {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: The number of datafiles is higher than {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}% of the available datafiles limit.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.total_pga_used.min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by Zabbix agent 2:oracle.pga_target.last()} > {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Total PGA inuse is too high (over {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: The total PGA in use is more than {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}% of PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET.
